DataElement.preferredName: Recurrent Disease Assessment Molecular Analysis Disease or Disorder Finding Yes No Character Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the molecular assessment used to assess the disease relapse showed evidence of disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Recurrent Disease Assessment Molecular Analysis Disease or Disorder Finding
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of remission._The act of judging the value, significance, or extent of something._Techniques for studying or analyzing the genetic composition and mechanisms of living organisms at the molecular level. May refer to the understanding and manipulation of genes (DNA)._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.:Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.:Techniques for studying or analyzing the genetic composition and mechanisms of living organisms at the molecular level. May refer to the understanding and manipulation of genes (DNA).

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
A laboratory procedure that involves the study of tissues, cells, and fluids using DNA/RNA analysis techniques for the identification of characteristics and abnormalities at the molecular level.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: .11/8/12mn-Concept definition change in NCIt for 'Finding C3376' Was: Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining physician (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom). Now: Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease. no version change needed.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes or No to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated to add NCIt concept relationship. Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the molecular assessment
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the molecular assessment used to assess disease relapse show evidence of disease?

DataElement.changeDescription: .4/3/12mn-removed cs 2110/2111 only..11/8/12mn-Concept definition change in NCIt for 'Finding C3376' Was: Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining physician (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom). Now: Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease. no version change needed.Alt name removed due to being used on CDE 2861259.
